title: Denali National Park & Preserve: Portfolio of Management Plans
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning     Portfolio of Management Plans               Portfolio of Management Plans       Foundation Statement - The Foundation Statement describes the unit’s purpose, significance, fundamental resources and values, primary interpretive themes, and special mandates.  Denali's Foundation Statement (2014) [pdf 56.7MB]    General Management Plan, et al – Comprehensive park plans that guide the long-term management of resources, visitor use, and general development at the park.     General Management Plan (completed in 1986)  Backcountry Management Plan (Record of Decision signed February, 2006)  Entrance Area and Road Corridor Development Concept Plan and EIS (Record of Decision signed February, 1997) South Denali Implementation Plan & EIS (Record of Decision signed June 2006)   Fire Management Plan - Provides direction for wildland fire management.   Transportation Plans - These assess and monitors transportation related issues, performance and maintenance.  Denali Vehicle Management Plan (Record of Decision signed September, 2012)    Long-Range Interpretive Plan - Long-Range Interpretive Plans (LRIPs) provide a vision for the future (5-10 years) of interpretation, education, and visitor experience opportunities.  The Denali Education Plan is a broad-scoped document designed to describe a 20-year vision for the development of an exemplary education program at Denali National Park and Preserve. Download the Denali Education Plan (3.7 MB)   Resource Stewardship Strategy (2009)  Bear-Human Conflict Management Plan (2003) - The purpose of the Bear-Human Conflict Management Plan is to provide general guidelines that minimize bear-human conflict in Denali, with goals based on policies of the NPS and legislation specific to Denali.
